column4: you are running boxed goods trucks to printing works i am supplying, yes?
ok, just to let you know of another option for you
i have boxed goods trains linking printing works to Pollinglock paper yard
do you know if multiplayer can trans-ship between players?
Goods transfer is possible. To achieve this, you have to make the station public.
because if it can, you can just send trucks to Pollinglock paper yard and all ink and books will go to and from there
Public means public, so any player can connect.
It is the rightmost button in the special tools menu.
also, there is no password on my player. if vehicles become stuck you can take over the player and fix them
i am trying to design my network so that vehicles cannot get stuck and block supply, but i am not so good at it
As far as I can see your network is not so bad.
i left it with too many paper trains to one factory, it got stuck while i was away
To avoid this you can st a maximum waiting time in the line management.
yes, i didn't think of that
also, it is impossible to rail paper for a profit
That's true. If you want to make a minimum profit with paper transport you should use paper trucks.
But paper transport sholldn't be an issue because you make profit by hauling books.
yes, i was losing money after being stuck but i think i am ok now
i am making good money on passengers
let me know if you need anything supplied on my network
Not at this point of time, but I really appreciate your offer. Thnk you very much!
just looking at what's happened since i was last here
someone has built an airport at pollingden
so it appears anyone can make any station public, yes?
or could they do that because i have no password on my player?
No, you can only make your own station public. You really should set a pw to protect your network.
i am not too concerned, curious to see what happens actually
i can always start another one
and i am happy for others to connect to it as you have
good if i can make that easy for people
also if others can unstick the network if they are relying on it
